intro: Pimpinella xizangensis, commonly known as the Tibet cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Tibet. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes with cool temperatures. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Pimpinella xizangensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
